results.title: Methods of water rescue
results.creator_credit: Kingcroft Productions, John Kingsford-Smith and Maria Boldini
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Advance Australia”.
A team of schoolboys demonstrate, both on land and in the water, methods of rescue, release and resuscitation. Shows methods of rescue for calm and struggling patients; release from the clutch of a panic-stricken patient; rescue methods for an unconscious patient; resuscitation by the Schaeffer methods; restoration of blood circulation by massage of the limbs. The film concludes with demonstration of a number of fancy swimming strokes.

results.title: Methods of family planning
results.creator_credit: Moreland-Latchford Productions, John Churchill and Jan Steen
results.brief_description: Accurately and objectively explains the human reproductive cycle and all presently practised methods of practising it are seen as a matter of personal choice. Illustrates by animation. Avoids social and moral considerations.

results.title: Methods analysis
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Industrial Management”.
Methods analysis is used to reduce production costs by increasing the productivity of men and machines. The film demonstrates the basic approach and techniques of the methods analyst in studying the manufacturing cycle and indicates methods for gaining employee co-operation.

results.title: Methods - Drafting - Research
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Writers on Writing”.
Writers on Writing is based on a growing archive of video material, of conversations between contemporary writers discussing their work. The material has been re-edited to form a resource for students and teachers of English, and each of the six twenty minute videos focuses on different aspects and stages of the writing process. Each video is accompanied by a resource booklet. In this video, writers talk about how they go about the writing process and the role of drafting and research in their work.

results.title: Methods
results.creator_credit: De Frenes and United States. Navy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic typing”.
Demonstrates the correct posture for typing and proper fingering of the keys; shows the use of the shift key, back spaces, tabulator, carriage return lever, and other parts on both manual and electric machines; also discusses the funtion of various fixtures on the machine. Correct use of single sheets and carbon pack is also demonstrated, together with the use of the paper lever and carriage release lever.

results.title: Method study basic principles
results.brief_description: The systematic approach to method study — the essence of which lies in the critical questioning of existing procedures and which results in increased productivity, lower unit costs, easier work and higher earnings. Case examples come from garage work, furniture and electrical manufacture and Local Government.

results.title: Meteorites, asteroids and comets
results.creator_credit: Coastal Community Colleges and David P. Stone
results.brief_description:
Episode number 25 of Series “Universe: the infinite frontier: an introductory astronomy telecourse”.
Meteorites have crashed to the Earth since time began with massive craters proving this, although scientists initially found it difficult to believe. Once it was determined that the rocks were “out of this world”, serious study was given to the phenomena. The location of the asteriod belt between Mars and Jupiter implies the existence of a now disintegrated planet. These asteriods are composed of three types: silicate, metal and carbon based. Comets have always been seen as “emissaries of chaos”. Halley’s Comet has offered scientists a chance to study this celestial body, which is largely an ice ball on an orbit through space. Comets have been known to cause destruction upon impact, and scientists believe that such a collision, which would result in mass devastation, may have explained the sudden extinction of dinosaurs on Earth. The likelihood of such an event re-occuring is also discussed.
